title: Leader of Mexico’s Powerful Oil-Workers’ Union Resigns
text:
MEXICO CITY—The longtime leader of Mexico’s powerful oil-workers’ union resigned Wednesday, amid mounting corruption allegations after a 26-year tenure that made him one of the country’s power brokers.

The resignation of Carlos Romero Deschamps came days after the government of President Andrés Manuel López Obrador presented two complaints against him before federal prosecutors. The complaints, filed by the Finance Ministry’s intelligence unit, allege money laundering and embezzlement, according to a senior government official.
